item.title: 9 New Prime Video Shows and Movies to Watch for September 2025
item.dc:creator: Chris Snellgrove
item.description: Cool nights call for hot new movies and TV shows. Here are the latest offerings from Prime Video to keep you warm!
item.content:encoded: If you have an appetite for great entertainment, finding an awesome new movie or TV show is like pulling up to a loaded buffet. After all, hitting that “keep watching” button is like refilling your plate, again and again. And when the shows and movies are good enough, it’s hard to stop eating–er, streaming.

item.title: Pro Res Zoom on the Pixel 10 Pro Is Ridiculously Good
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Google's Pixel 10 Pro boasts an incredible 100x Pro Res Zoom, but is it just too good?
item.content:encoded: Google loves AI and cameras, which is why both are front and center on the new Pixel 10 Pro and Pixel 10 Pro XL smartphones. While I have mixed feelings about AI appearing everywhere, its use in Google's new Pro Res Zoom (100x) camera mode is not only impressive, it's almost too good.

item.title: These 3 Netflix Shows Have My Full Attention Right Now
item.dc:creator: Keeley Brooks
item.description: Simple idiots, magic pranks, and time travel. What more could an entertainment enthusiast ask for?
item.content:encoded: Netflix is a hotbed of viewing entertainment activity that I, for one, just can’t quit. There’s so much to choose from, I find that, at any given moment, I’m watching a myriad of titles in different genres.

item.title: The Most Affordable Pickup Trucks In 2025
item.dc:creator: Brent vd Schyff
item.description: Here are most affordable trucks you can buy in 2025.
item.content:encoded: Who's not a fan of an affordable pickup? They offer something unique, making it easier to get around the city and get the job done. They catalyze business initiatives to take off and then some. Individuals aspiring to pursue entrepreneurship (sound the trumpets) find them to be the perfect gateway to bigger opportunities later. That's if the need ever arises.

item.title: Flip Phones: The One Flaw That Ruins It All (For Me)
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: A Surprising Drawback of Flip Phones
item.content:encoded: When the original Galaxy Fold launched, I was impressed with the foldable technology, but wasn’t convinced I needed it. Then came the compact flip phones, and I was immediately much more interested. I’ve tried many of them since, but one problem keeps popping up.

item.title: This Captivating Show Is Worth an AMC+ Subscription
item.dc:creator: Keeley Brooks
item.description: You've never seen this side of London before.
item.content:encoded: AMC+ has several series worth a subscription, but one of the main reasons I subscribe is for access to a U.K.-based action thriller that raises the bar on what constitutes a gritty crime thriller masterpiece.

item.title: 5 Essential Ryobi Tools to Supercharge Your DIY Projects
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Unlock your DIY potential with these must-have Ryobi tools. From sawzalls to impact drivers, top off your toolbox.
item.content:encoded: Finding the right tool for the job can sometimes be a challenge, but once you do, it'll level up your DIY game and make even the most difficult projects easier. If you've just bought into the Ryobi ecosystem, or are considering it, here are five must-have Ryobi tools.

item.title: Best Movie Years Ever: 1982—Genre Films Rein Supreme
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: This was the monumental year that gave us classics like E.T., Blade Runner, and Conan the Barbarian.
item.content:encoded: 1982 was a fantastic year for genre film lovers. There was plenty of sci-fi and fantasy for all ages, ranging from violent revenge in the time of sorcery to charming alien adventures fit for the family. Whether it was swords or spaceships, there was something for you.

item.title: RIP Nova Launcher, Pixel 10 Reviews, and Google Photos Features: Android This Week
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: Android news, editorials, and more from the last 7 days.
item.content:encoded: It was a particularly interesting week in the Android world. One of the oldest and most beloved apps by long-time Android users was put out to pasture. We also reviewed both the Pixel 10 Pro and Pixel 10. And some Google apps got some new goodies.

item.title: 3 Things I Still Refuse to Go Digital On
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: I might be a terminally-online computer geek, but about some things I'm an analog holdout.
item.content:encoded: Despite how my job and hobbies mostly revolve around the digital world, even I have my limits. It may well be 2025, but I still refuse to throw my money into the "modern" digital versions of certain products.
